author: g
message: I'm sorry to ask this question (I don't want to criticize your hard work), but is there a possibility to switch off inline renaming? Inline renaming is one of the most horrible "features" ever implemented in any program (I hated it in windows, I hate it in dolphin, konqueror, and most of all, I hate it in file dialogs, luckily it can be switched off in these KDE apps). The reason why I hate it is because it gets triggered in 95% of the cases when I click on a filename (because clearly the duration of my mouse button presses is the same as the duration needed to trigger inline renaming), and I get really pissed when a file dialog/dolphin starts renaming a file when I just want to select it (that is one of the reasons why I cannot use windows: I am near nervous breakdown after 5 minutes using it because of such "features"). I have no problems though with renaming triggered by F2 or by selecting the "Rename" entry in the popup menu which appears using the right mouse button.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: Inline renaming in Gwenview can only be triggered by F2 or from the File or context menu, not by click, so you should be safe.

replies.author: g
replies.message: That is great news! Thanks for your great work!!!
